definition: important/vital/to want/to ask for/will/going to (as future auxiliary)/may/must/(used in a comparison) must be/probably/if
affair/business/matter/to be engaged in/to attend to/by all means

sentences.english: The first thing to remember is not to criticize anyone.
sentences.chinese: 记得第一要务就是不要批语别人。

sentences.english: It is number-one priority to deliver these relief supplies to flood-hit areas.
sentences.chinese: 把这些救灾物质送到洪灾区是当前的第一要务。

sentences.english: Scienctific research is the first important affair of an agricultural science institutes.
sentences.chinese: 科研工作是农业科研院所第一要务。

sentences.english: My path and life's work are my highest priorities.
sentences.chinese: 我的道途与人生志业是我最优先的要务。

sentences.english: Executives say combatting scams has become the top priority for 2007.
sentences.chinese: 负责人员说，反欺诈已经成为2007年的头等要务。

sentences.english: Development is the Party’s top priority in governing and rejuvenating the country.
sentences.chinese: 发展是我们党执政兴国的第一要务。

sentences.english: He made it his number-one priority when he was in office.
sentences.chinese: 当选后，他也把酒精饮品的解禁当做了第一要务。

sentences.english: Pure Land beginners who wish to cultivate strong letter ready to service.
sentences.chinese: 初学净土者，宜以培植坚固信愿为要务。

sentences.english: The business of life is to go-forward.
sentences.chinese: 生命的要务是奋力向前。

sentences.english: It could be a back-office HR person. The trick for enterprise software developers is hooking them.
sentences.chinese: 企业软件开发人员的要务是如何吸引这些人。

sentences.english: Bringing these rescue material to the flood-hit area is the top priority.
sentences.chinese: 把这些救灾物质送到洪灾区是当前的第一要务。

definition: top priority job/matter of vital importance
(political, economic etc) affairs/work/transaction (as in a computer database)
the best policy/the best thing one can do in the circumstances
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
to assume full responsibility/to be in full control/to monopolize
